src:
Liverpool Ancam Mundur dari Carabao Cup, Memangnya Bisa?
01 Nov 2019, 02:30 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Perjalanan Liverpool di ajang Carabao Cup bisa saja berakhir lebih dini. Pasalnya sang pelatih, Jurgen Klopp, merasa tidak sreg dengan tanggal laga babak perempat final yang ditentukan oleh penyelenggara.
The Reds dipastikan melaju ke babak perempat final setelah berhasil mengalahkan Arsenal di 16 besar hari Kamis (31/10/2019). Liverpool dipastikan sebagai pemenang melalui adu penalti dengan skor 5-4.
Pertandingan itu sendiri berjalan dengan seru, di mana kedua tim saling kejar-kejaran selama 90 menit penuh. Arsenal berkali-kali berada dalam situasi unggul, namun Liverpool tak berhenti menyamakan kedudukan. Di waktu normal, keduanya bermain imbang 5-5.
Dua dari lima gol Liverpool dicetak oleh Divock Origi, satu lainnya berasal dari aksi bunuh diri Shkodran Mustafi, dan sisanya dikantongi Oxlade-Chamberlain dan James Milner. Sementara gol Arsenal dicetak Lucas Torreira, Maitland-Niles, Joe Willock, dan dua diborong Gabriel Martinelli.

Scroll ke bawah untuk membaca informasi selengkapnya.
text:
Liverpool Threatens to Withdraw from Carabao Cup, Can It Be?
01 Nov 2019, 02:30 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Liverpool's trip at the Carabao Cup could have ended early. The reason is the coach, Jurgen Klopp, did not feel comfortable with the date of the quarterfinal round match determined by the organizer.
The Reds certainly advance to the quarter-finals after defeating Arsenal in the last 16 on Thursday (10/31/2019). Liverpool confirmed as winners on penalties with a score of 5-4.
The game itself went on with excitement, where the two teams chased each other for the full 90 minutes. Arsenal have been in superior situations many times, but Liverpool have not stopped equalizing. In normal time, both draw 5-5.
Two of Liverpool's five goals were scored by Divock Origi, the other one came from the suicide of Shkodran Mustafi, and the rest were bagged by Oxlade-Chamberlain and James Milner. While Arsenal scored scored Lucas Torreira, Maitland-Niles, Joe Willock, and two hired by Gabriel Martinelli.

Scroll down to read full information.
